name: src/controller.mjs
config
description: Configuration of which buttons / analogs map to which indexes

name: rightAnalogHeld
description: Whether the right analog is currently being held

name: baseAnalogPos
description: The base analogs position when it is not in use

name: AXES
description: Analog thumb sticks

name: AXIS_UPDATE_RANGE
description: The range at which axis changes are detected

name: ANALOG_RELEASE_RANGE
description: The range at which the analog is considered to be dropped -0.09 - 0.09

name: TRIGGER_PRESSED_VALUE
description: The value at which holding a trigger (LT OR RT) will consider it being pressed

name: PRESSED
description: Value to indicate a pressed button

name: UNPRESSED
description: Value to indicate a button is not pressed

name: BUTTONS_MAP
description: A button map that maps common button names to the indexes the computer knows them as

name: PS4_REMAPPED
description: A small remapped version of the controllers button_map with PS4 alternatives

name: pressed
description: Object full of the currently held down buttons

name: info
description: Info about the controller

name: rightAnalogPos
description: The right analogs position

name: pressHandlers
description: Object of stored callback that will call when a button is pressed

name: releaseHandlers
description: Object of stored callback that will call when a button is released

name: axisHandlers
description: Object of stored callbacks that will call when the axis is changed

name: timestamp
description: The timestamp of the gamepad.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new controller instance and passes the gamepad it will be created with

params.name: pGamepad
params.description: A gamepad object

name: getType
description: Returns the type the controller is. PC / PS / Xbox / Android

name: updateState
description: Update the state of this controller with the latest polled information

params.description: The gamepad with the new updated state
The gamepad controller instance

name: getPressed
description: Gets the current buttons pressed down on the gamepad.

name: on
description: Attaches a callback to the specified event.

params.name: pEvent
params.description: The event to attach the callback to

params.name: pCallback
params.description: The function to be called when the event is triggered

name: off
description: Removes a callback from the specified event.

params.name: pEvent
params.description: The event to remove the callback from

name: handleButtonInput
description: Handles the input on the buttons.

params.name: pButton
params.description: The button index that was pressed

params.name: pValue
params.description: The value of the button (0 for unpressed, 1 for pressed) 0-1 for buttons that have a range

params.name: pRepeat
params.description: Whether this button is still being held from a previous frame

params.name: pPressed
params.description: Whether this button is being pressed in this current frame.

name: handleAxisInput
description: Handles the input on the analogs.

params.name: pAxis
params.description: The axis index that was moved

params.name: pValue
params.description: The value of the axis that was moved (0-1 range)

params.name: pRepeat
params.description: Whether this axes is still the same from a previous frame

name: handleGrabAnalog
description: Handles the event for when a analog is grabbed.

params.name: pAnalog
params.description: Analog that was grabbed

name: handleDropAnalog
description: Handles the event for when a analog is dropped.

params.name: pAnalog
params.description: Analog that was dropped

name: isLeftAnalogHeld
description: Whether the left analog is being held

name: isRightAnalogHeld
description: Whether the right analog is being held

name: isButtonPressed
description: Checks whether a button is pressed down or not

params.name: pButtonName
params.description: The button to check if its pressed

name: vibrate
description:
Vibrate the controller (experimental)

dual-rumble: Dual-rumble describes a haptic configuration with an eccentric rotating mass vibration motor in each handle of a standard gamepad. 
In this configuration, either motor is capable of vibrating the whole gamepad. 
The two masses are unequal so that the effects of each can be combined to create more complex haptic effects.

params.name: pVibrationType
params.description: The type of rumble. "dual-rumble", or "vibration"

params.name: pStartDelay
params.description: The start delay before the vibration occurs in ms

params.name: pWeakMagnitude
params.description: The magnitude of the weak actuator (between 0 and 1).

params.name: pStrongMagnitude
params.description: The magnitude of the strong actuator (between 0 and 1).

name: pulse
description: The pulse() method of the GamepadHapticActuator interface makes the hardware pulse at a certain intensity for a specified duration. (From MDN)

params.name: pValue
params.description: A double representing the intensity of the pulse. This can vary depending on the hardware type, but generally takes a value between 0.0 (no intensity) and 1.0 (full intensity).

params.name: pDuration
params.description: A double representing the duration of the pulse, in milliseconds.

name: src/gamepad.mjs
GamepadManagerSingleton
description: A gamepadmanager to help with games / handling input from a controller
todo:
Currently bluetooth gamepads when disconnecting (PS4 only) do no fire a disconnected event. Manually calling `this.gamepad.vibrationActuator.reset()` can force it to call a disconnect event, but 
this is a messy way of checking each tick to see if the gamepad is still connected. It also will cancel ongoing vibrations. Find a fix. (This is a GamepadAPI issue/OS issue/not code wise issue)

unknown.tagValue: GamepadManager does not have a license at this time. For licensing contact the author

name: controllers
description: Object containing all connected controllers

name: connectHandler
description: Object containing the callback for when a controller is connected

name: disconnectHandler
description: Object containing the callback for when a controller is disconnected

name: version
description: The version of the module.

name: constructor
description: Creates the instance and assigns event handlers to gamepad events

name: logger
description: The logger module this module uses to log errors / logs.

name: getAngle
description: Gets the angle between two points

unknown.tagValue: {number} The angle between the starting point and the ending point

params.name: pStartPoint
params.description: The starting point

params.name: pEndPoint
params.description: The ending point

return.description: The angle between the starting point and the ending point

name: getMainController
description: This gets the first controller connected. This controller is dominant

unknown.tagValue: {Array} An array of all connected controllers

return.description: An array of all connected controllers

name: on
description: Attaches a callback to the specified event.

params.name: pEvent
params.description: The event to attach the callback to

params.name: pCallback
params.description: The function to be called when the event is triggered

name: handleGamepadConnected
description: Listener function for when a gamepad is connected

params.description: A gamepad event

name: handleGamepadDisconnected
description: Listener function for when the gamepad is disconnected

params.description: A gamepad event

name: pollGamepadState
description: Get the latest game state of the connected gamepads (Chrome only saves snapshots of the state, we have to keep polling to get updated states)

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "gamepad",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A gamepadmanager to help with games / handling input from a controller",
  "main": "src/gamepad.mjs",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
    "build:rollup": "npx rollup -c",
    "build:docs": "esdoc -c esdoc.json",
    "build:dist": "npm run build:rollup && npm run build:docs"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "https://github.com/doubleactii",
  "license": "MIT",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/EvitcaStudio/Gamepad"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/EvitcaStudio/Gamepad/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/EvitcaStudio/Gamepad#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@rollup/plugin-babel": "^6.0.4",
    "@rollup/plugin-terser": "^0.4.4",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "rollup": "^4.14.1",
    "rollup-plugin-banner2": "^1.2.3",
    "rollup-plugin-cleandir": "^2.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-replace": "^2.2.0"
  }
}
name: package.json
